topic_metadata.title: Could one create a package that invokes lilypond (an external command) and embeds the result?

posts.name: Alex Harter
posts.cooked: What would it take to create a package that provides a lilypond function that invokes the lilypond command and automatically embeds the resulting output? Are there any packages that do something similar?
posts.raw: What would it take to create a package that provides a lilypond function that invokes the lilypond command and automatically embeds the resulting output?  Are there any packages that do something similar?

posts.name: Johann Birnick
posts.cooked:
Impossible at the moment. A package cannot call an external command.

If you want to do that for your personal project, you have to make a custom build script that first runs lilypond, puts the output somewhere, and then renders the Typst document (which includes the lilypond output somewhere).
posts.raw:
Impossible at the moment. A package cannot call an external command.

If you want to do that for your personal project, you have to make a custom build script that first runs lilypond, puts the output somewhere, and then renders the Typst document (which includes the lilypond output somewhere).

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
This recent answer may interest you:

How to call external applications? Questions
There has been extensive discussion about this in the past, but this functionality (often referred to as “shell escape” in reference to LaTeX’s equivalent functionality) unfortunately isn’t really compatible with several of Typst’s aspects, including portability (being able to compile the same document in different environments), purity (function calls in Typst must always produce the same result to make memoization possible), security (compiling a Typst document must not produce unexpected side…
posts.raw:
This recent answer may interest you:
